trans-unit.source: Using Twilio for Voice, VoIP, and SMS Messaging in Azure
trans-unit.target: Using Twilio for Voice, VoIP, and SMS Messaging in Azure

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to build apps that communicate with Twilio and node.js on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to build apps that communicate with Twilio and node.js on Azure.

trans-unit.source: What is Twilio?
trans-unit.target: What is Twilio?

trans-unit.source: Twilio is an API platform that makes it easy for developers to make and receive phone calls, send and receive text messages, and embed VoIP calling into browser-based and native mobile applications.
trans-unit.target: Twilio is an API platform that makes it easy for developers to make and receive phone calls, send and receive text messages, and embed VoIP calling into browser-based and native mobile applications.

trans-unit.source: Let's briefly go over how this works before diving in.
trans-unit.target: Let's briefly go over how this works before diving in.

trans-unit.source: Receiving Calls and Text Messages
trans-unit.target: Receiving Calls and Text Messages

trans-unit.source: Twilio allows developers to [purchase programmable phone numbers][purchase_phone] which can be used to both send and receive calls and text messages.
trans-unit.target: Twilio allows developers to [purchase programmable phone numbers][purchase_phone] which can be used to both send and receive calls and text messages.

trans-unit.source: When a Twilio number receives an inbound call or text, Twilio will send your web application an HTTP POST or GET request, asking you for instructions on how to handle the call or text.
trans-unit.target: When a Twilio number receives an inbound call or text, Twilio will send your web application an HTTP POST or GET request, asking you for instructions on how to handle the call or text.

trans-unit.source: Your server will respond to Twilio's HTTP request with [TwiML][twiml], a simple set of XML tags that contain instructions on how to handle a call or text.
trans-unit.target: Your server will respond to Twilio's HTTP request with [TwiML][twiml], a simple set of XML tags that contain instructions on how to handle a call or text.

trans-unit.source: We will see examples of TwiML in just a moment.
trans-unit.target: We will see examples of TwiML in just a moment.

trans-unit.source: Making Calls and Sending Text Messages
trans-unit.target: Making Calls and Sending Text Messages

trans-unit.source: By making HTTP requests to the Twilio web service API, developers can send text messages or initiate outbound phone calls.
trans-unit.target: By making HTTP requests to the Twilio web service API, developers can send text messages or initiate outbound phone calls.

trans-unit.source: For outbound calls, the developer must also specify a URL that returns TwiML instructions for how to handle the outbound call once it is connected.
trans-unit.target: For outbound calls, the developer must also specify a URL that returns TwiML instructions for how to handle the outbound call once it is connected.

trans-unit.source: Embedding VoIP Capabilities in UI code (JavaScript, iOS, or Android)
trans-unit.target: Embedding VoIP Capabilities in UI code (JavaScript, iOS, or Android)

trans-unit.source: Twilio provides a client-side SDK which can turn any desktop web browser, iOS app, or Android app into a VoIP phone.
trans-unit.target: Twilio provides a client-side SDK which can turn any desktop web browser, iOS app, or Android app into a VoIP phone.

trans-unit.source: In this article, we will focus on how to use VoIP calling in the browser.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we will focus on how to use VoIP calling in the browser.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the Twilio JavaScript SDK running in the browser, a server-side application (our node.js application) must be used to issue a "capability token" to the JavaScript client.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the Twilio JavaScript SDK running in the browser, a server-side application (our node.js application) must be used to issue a "capability token" to the JavaScript client.

trans-unit.source: You can read more about using VoIP with node.js [on the Twilio dev blog][voipnode].
trans-unit.target: You can read more about using VoIP with node.js [on the Twilio dev blog][voipnode].

trans-unit.source: Configuring Twilio Credentials in System Environment Variables
trans-unit.target: Configuring Twilio Credentials in System Environment Variables

trans-unit.source: In order to make authenticated requests against the Twilio back end, we need our account SID and auth token, which function as the username and password set for our Twilio account.
trans-unit.target: In order to make authenticated requests against the Twilio back end, we need our account SID and auth token, which function as the username and password set for our Twilio account.

trans-unit.source: The most secure way to configure these for use with the node module in Azure is via system environment variables, which you can set directly in the Azure admin console.
trans-unit.target: The most secure way to configure these for use with the node module in Azure is via system environment variables, which you can set directly in the Azure admin console.

trans-unit.source: Select your node.js website, and click the "CONFIGURE" link.
trans-unit.target: Select your node.js website, and click the "CONFIGURE" link.

trans-unit.target: If you scroll down a bit, you will see an area where you can set configuration properties for your application.
